Reviewed structure; removed some incorrect MILESTONEs in commentary Ps; changed TRAILER to CLOSER; moved end of LG; added EPIGRAPH Q L at end; changed DIV2 to DIV1. Checked placement and completeness of PBs. Checked for damage GAPs, #s, @s, --s, and UNCLEARs. Corrected [dollar]s. Checked for &cs with incorrect spacing. Checked for LBs. Checked for startqs and endqs, abq's, oes, qs, Ae's, and Qs. Checked proofsheets and made corrections. Checked italic I / J and U / V. Checked for missing page GAPs. Checked for EPIGRAPHs and ARGUMENTS. Checked CLOSERs, OPENERs, SIGNEDs, SALUTEs, TRAILERs, BYLINEs. Checked decorated initials. Checked FIGUREs. Sample: 2 minutes. Proofing: 0 minutes. Tag review and corrections: 50 minutes. DONE.

DIV1.HEAD: DAS 'TRENTALLE SANCTI GREGORII' IN DER EDINBURGHER HANDSCHRIFT.

LG.L: Some tyme in Rome a pope þer was,
Þat hade a modur fułł fayre of face,
And þe beste, I vndirstonde,
Þat was holden in in über der zeile zugefügt. Romes londe,
Of fastyng and of preyers, as we rede,
And of oþer almes dede;
Tyl at þe deuełł, þat neuer can blyn,
Had broght hor in a preuey syn. syne in der handschrift, mit aus∣punktiertem e.
Ho dorst noght telle no man:
Ho was holden so god a womon.
To mynour ne to frere Austyn,
To caryne ne to Jacobyn,
To no prist ne to clarke
Ho durst not schow hor yvel warke;
Tyl sykenes told hor wondur sore
Þat ho trowed to lyf no more.
To þe pope hore son ho sende
Hor to consełł and to mende,
To com to hor als be-lyffe
Yf he wolde se hure on lyffe.
Of þis tyþandis was he not blythe;
Bot to his modur he wente swythe,
And he askede hure of hure fare.
Ho sayde, ho was in mycułł care,
Where-fore ho lust no more to lyuen;
Bot to hym ho wold be schryuen.
"Alas", he sayde, "alas for syn,
So fayre with-out and fole with-in!
Synfułł I haue byn mony a day:
Son, of consełł I þe pray.
Bot yf þat I haue rede of þe,
I trow neuer saffe to be.
Þre chyldur I haue borne
Foll preuely, þey byn for-lorne.
For I was holden so gud in londe,
I slo hom ałł with my honde
Thorooȝħ combrons of þe devel of hełłe;
Þis syn for schame I durst neuer tełłe.
A-las, how schołł I saued be,
My dere son, with-out red of þe?"
Þe pope answart wepyng sore:
"Godis mercy is wełłe more,
My dere modur, þen þi syne;
Yf þou be sory with-in,
I telle þe, modur, wełł securly
God of þi sole wyłłe haue merycy. Sic! lies mercy.
Bot panans I wyłł gyff þe non;
I se, þi lyf wyłł sone be gone:
In hełłe or in purgatory with-outon drede
Þi sole mot bye þi lyvies Sic! lies lyves. dede.
Yelde þe, modur, to God ałłmyght!
For þe I pray both day and nyght.
For hys mercy and hys pete
Pardon of syn he graunt gramt in der hs. to þe.
Bot, god modur, my dere dame,
Yf þou may with-outon blame
Of Gode to tełł me me mit sehr undeutlichem e in der hs., welches aus y gebessert scheint. þe grame,
I pray þe in Godis name,
When þou art dede in wele or wo,
God m[o]dur, do ryght so!"
"My swet son, þer schałł Hs. schlałł, wovon das erste l durch punkte getilgt ist. no slowthe
Lyt me þer from Hs. fron.; here my trowthe!
Yf God voche-safe, I com a-gayne
To tełł my state; I wyłł fułł fayne."
Ho had vnnethe þes wordis sayde,
Bot ho yelde þe gost in a bryde.
Sone to þe gronde þi con hor bere bryng,
And beryd hor with-outon lesyng.
Þe goste com þe þyrde nyght
To þe pope, a rufułł wyght.
As blake hym þoȝt as any pyche
With burnand fyre Hs. frye, doch sind r und y durch punkte als verstellt bezeichnet.: he se neuer syche;
Þe chambur glyssnet ałł a-bowte.
Þer-of þe pope had grete dowte,
And of þe gret stynke ałł-so,
Þat made hym for to wake þo.
Þer he hade an yvełł fytte,
Þat hade negħ lost hys wytt.
Bot at þe laste vp he breyde:
And rufully þis wordis he sayde:
"Bene-dicite in Godis name,
Wo is þer?" Ho says: "Þi dame."
Of þat askyng þo gost was glade;
Þe Pope for ferde was nere made:
"Alas", he sayde, "how art þou stade?"
"I am comun so as þou me badde
For my socour and my prowe
To helpe me of my vowe.
My dere son, for charite!
Helpe me, as þou hattest me!
Þer is no tonge þat may telle
Peynes I soffur, þay byn so fełł.
Þis hundrtħ yere I haue hom borne;
Bot I haue helpe, I am fore-lorne."
He vnswart with sory harte:
"Me rewes, modur, of of über der zeile nachgetragen. þi smarte:
Yf þer be oght þat helpe ȝow may,
Tełł me, modur, I ȝow pray."
Þe sole sayd with sore sykynge Der reim hierzu fehlt.:
"Wo so dose hyt in hys lyff day,
Wełł is hym, he may say,
Þat euer yytt was borne,
For pynes thare hym dred non forne
Of purgatory no of hełłe,
Whecħ peynes byn I-lyke fułł iłł;
Þe ton hase ende, þat oþer is bowte:
Wyłł is hym, is hom with-out:—
Thre masses of Crystes natiuite,
And thre of epyphanys,
And thre of þe paryfycacyon,
And thre of þe annunciacion Hs. arnericiacōm̄.,
And thre of þe resureccion,
And thre of þe ascencioun,
And of þe Holy Gost thre schałł a über der zeile zugefügt. be
And oþere thre of þe trinite,
And of oure laydis assumpcion thre,
And als mony of here natiuite:
And ałł þes massus, I þe pryae So in der hs.,
With-ine hor vtas þou hom say.
And yytt wele more þou hase to do:
Placebo and dirige þou say þer-to!
Also I pray þe, my dere son,
Þat þou say þis oreson:
'God þat made ałł and som,
And yeld þi selfe fore oure raunson,
Þou wold be borne be-fore ałł oþer
In þe londe of be-hest, to be oure broþer;
And as þou suffert detħ for us,
Delyuer þis soule Hs. solue, das zu soule gebessert ist., þou swete Jhesu[s],
Out of þe fendis hondis fełłe!
Grant hyt, lorde, in joy to dwełł!
Þo folke, lord, of mys-beleve
Þou helpe hom, lorde, or hyt hom greue!
And, lorde, for þi grette pete,
Þou helpe hom, lord, ałł þat trylis in þe'."
Þe pope vnswart a-non ryghte:
"Hyt shałł be done with ałł my myght.
Nowe, god modur, I pray the,
Wen hyt is done, þou com to me
To tel me of þi fare.
God bryng vs botħ out of care!"
Þen sayd þe gost: "I wyłł fułł fayne.
Yf God voche-safe, I com a-gayne,
To tełł þe at þe last,
Wen ałł my paynes byn past.
Fare wełł, son, for now I go;
For Godis lofe þynke on my wo!"
Þe pope lett send swytħ sone Die zeile mit dem reim auf sone fehlt.
To þe freres of saynte Austen,
To mynor or to Jacobyn,
And to þe freres of Mont Carmele—
With hys blesyng he gret hom wełłe—
To prist and clarke þat woned in Rome,
To pylgrimus þat þedur com:
He bade hom on þis blesyng
Hys modur sole to [haue] in mynde
In hor prayers and byddyng;
Hym selffe wolde þe masses syng.
Wen þe trentałł was ałł done,
Ho come a-gayne fułł sone,
Þe þryde nyght secorly
Aftur þe byrtħ of þore lady,
To þe pope in þis chambure
With þo most swette savour,
Þat euer he felde in his lyfe.
Þerwith þe pope wakende swytħ,
Mucħ Hs. Mcħ. myrtħe þer hard and fułł grete steuun;
He se fayre angłs were comn fro heuun:
Be-twene hom þey broȝt his modur i-wis,
Hym thoȝt ho was þe qwene of blys;
So fayre ho schon, so bryȝt ho was.
Þo pope knelet don in þat place
"Lade", he sayde, "I serued nouer þe,
Þat þou wolde schow þe to me,
As I schałł þe serue, swette lady:
Of my modur sole hafe mercy!"
"Nay", sayde þe sole, "þou mys-leuest:
I am not ho þat þou wenest;
Þi modur I am, and not þe qwene.
Blossed mot þou Hinter þou folgt be, welches aber durch einen strich und punkt ungültig gemacht ist. ever ben;
For thorogħ þi prayers, my dere son,
Euer in blysse I schałł won.
God of heuun brynge þe thedur,
Þat we may haue þat joy to-gedur
And to þe blesse þen com we."
"Amen", sayd ałł, "for charyte!"
Here endes þe trentałł of Gergori. So in der hs.
God of oure soles haue merci!

Q.L: Be it trowe or be it fals,
It is os the cope was. Unten auf dieser seite steht deutlich geschrieben und von derselben hand: gorgys hopkyne nto XX pond of god boldurs.

DIV1.HEAD: Anmerkungen.
DIV1.P: Vers 11-12. Vgl. die verse 149-153. Ist caryne (in v. 12) eine verderbniss aus Carmelite? Vgl. v. 153 And to þe freres of Mont Carmele.
Vers 28. fole ist ne. foul; wegen der schreibung vgl. gronde 67, don 174.

Vers 37. Turnbull druckt combrous. Dieses adjectiv ist bei Mätzner nicht belegt und scheint erst im Ne. vorzukommen. Die hs. lässt die lesung combrons zu, worin nur das o der zweiten silbe ungewöhnlich ist; vgl. panans 47. Zeile 111 in paryfycacyon steht umgekehrt a für o (oder u) geschrieben. Der sinn verlangt eben das hauptwort combrans, cumbraunce, welches in der anderen hs. C, v. 25, auch steht.

Vers 56-57. Der infinitiv steht hier auffallenderweise mit to nach dem hülfszeitwort may. Kaluza stellt (Engl. Studien XIV, 179) unter zu∣ziehung von Zupitza's anmerkung zu Guy B v. 1925 die regel auf: 'In einem hauptsatze darf der von einem hülfszeitworte (will, shall, may, must, can) abhängige infinitiv im Me. die praep. to bei sich haben, wenn er mit starkem nachdruck dem hülfszeitwort vorangeht'; nach Zupitza (anmerkung zu Guy B v. 1925) auch dann, wenn er als zweiter inf. durch and mit dem ersten praepositionslosen verbunden ist. Das beispiel hier fällt nicht unter die regeln. Es scheint auch zu genügen, dass der inf. überhaupt durch längere zwischenstehende redeteile vom hülfszeitwort ge∣trennt ist.

Vers 85. stade ist participium zu steden und steht in der bedeutung, welche Mätzner häufig für bestad, bestade belegt hat auf seite 269 seines wörterbuchs (= 'bewältigt, überwältigt'); vergleiche auch Stratmann's beleg (seite 529): in sorowe was he stad.
Vers 93-94 sind verderbt; vgl. hs. C, vers 57.

Vers 101. Der ausgelassene vers lautete vielleicht wie v. 63 in hs. C: 'Ȝe, sone, for me þow mast synge'. Auf synge würde sich dann das folgende hyt beziehen, und nur so kann man die sonst unvermittelte auf∣zählung der messen in vers 108 ff. verstehen.
Vers 120. Vgl. Kaufmann's anmerkung 120 auf seite 52.
Vers 136. Das Lambeth-Ms. hat trusty, Vernon trusteþ anstatt des trylis (Kaufmann, seite 38).
Vers 175. nouer = never; vgl. schow 176. blossed 182.
